body:
This PR adds a validation for the arguments on the `-generate` command implemented in `bitcoin-cli` and provides more information when during the execution of the [command described here](https://github.com/bitcoin-core/gui/pull/692#issuecomment-1367470026), `bitcoin-cli `first tries to obtain a default wallet in order to execute different commands (including -generate) and that's the error we see and it's a bit confusing since the user specified `-rpcwallet.`

Reviewing [gui PR 692](https://github.com/bitcoin-core/gui/pull/692) stumpled upon with @RandyMcMilllan's [screenshot](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/152159/209985593-0fe468fc-038b-44d2-90fc-303ecc3944d4.png) and I've investigated also how ArgsManager handles and parses the command line arguments, it seems that it's implicit that arguments starting with "-" are ignored if they are after a non-optional argument (non-GNU option parsing, as we can see [in its code](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/114c5eca77fc3d4b4af812358ed471e7e5166e9d/src/util/system.cpp#L316) and [in the tests](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/547a96362888d2fa02d496c192dcdb7ea7d72813/src/test/argsman_tests.cpp#L226-L228) covering it.

So, a user running `-generate -rpcwallet=XXX` would expect also to the command `-generate -3 -rpcwallet=XX` to work but `-rpcwallet` in the last command is ignored and the failure indicates that there's no wallet loaded in the node or there are more than 1, that's why I'm adding also the suggestion to use the command `bitcoin-cli listwallets` to verify that that's the case.

In order to reproduce the issue please follow the steps:

1.- start a bitcoin node (easier to use regtest network): 
`$ bitcoind -regtest `

2.- if you don't have any wallet created, create one, this will also load it into the node: 
```
$ bitcoin-cli -regtest createwallet testWallet1
{
  "name": "testWallet1",
  "warning": ""
}
```

3.- otherwise just load the wallet you already have:
`$ bitcoin-cli -regtest loadwallet "yourWalletName"`

4.- repeat steps 2 or 3 depending on your setup but make sure you have 2 or more wallets loaded into the node, verify that with the `listwallets` command:
```
$ bitcoin-cli -regtest listwallets
[
  "testWallet2",
  "testWallet1"
]
```

5.- run the -generate command specifying the `-rpcwallet` you wish to generate:
```
$ bitcoin-cli -regtest -generate -rpcwallet=testWallet2
{
  "address": "bcrt1qmdsy3xnuhcyf766avnjhvdg5ftx2whm7fwlgcu",
  "blocks": [
    "242a2d9072bdaf4c334989291bf7925d42b02b5b4ad14ec4b19b3738579538ef"
  ]
}
```

You could also get a block generated if you run:
`$ bitcoin-cli -regtest -rpcwallet=testWallet2 -generate`
or
`$ bitcoin-cli -regtest -rpcwallet=testWallet2 -generate 1`

But you will get an error if you run:
```
$ bitcoin-cli -regtest -generate 1 -rpcwallet=testWallet2
error code: -19
error message:
Wallet file not specified (must request wallet RPC through /wallet/<filename> uri-path).
Try adding "-rpcwallet=<filename>" option to bitcoin-cli command line.
```
After the fix, you will get this output instead:
```
$ bitcoin-cli -regtest -generate 1 -rpcwallet=testWallet2
error: -generate command's arguments starting with "-" are not allowed ("-rpcwallet=testWallet2" in this case), please check -generate syntax.
```
If you remove `-rpcwallet` from the command above you will get:
```
$ bitcoin-cli -regtest -generate 1
error code: -19
error message:
Wallet file not specified (must request wallet RPC through /wallet/<filename> uri-path).
Try adding "-rpcwallet=<filename>" option to bitcoin-cli command line.
Usually there are more than one wallet loaded into the node, you could verify it running: bitcoin-cli listwallets.
```
title: bitcoin:cli add validation to -generate command to avoid confusion when it's used with -rpcwallet
